page.title: 05TORRY BATTERY 1
page.content: Looking south east from the harbour one can spot this Napoleonic fortification on the opposite headland.Armed then with 60 pounder guns it was a formidable defence only to become obselete at the end of the 19th century due to the improvements of armaments on ships of war. However it was still considered of stategic importance during the Second World War when a network of dugouts were established at the site-in case the invasion was to commence at Aberdeen.Apparently the 60 pounder guns were actually fired as a couple of suspicious ships sailed towards the harbour.Luckily they missed since the ships turned out to be friendly.
